item.title: Ted add a quote by Andre Malraux
item.description: "I don't argue with my enemies; I explain to their children." -- Andre Malraux

item.title: Ted add a quote by John Banville
item.description: "Art is amoral, whether we accept this or not; it does not take sides. The finest fictions are cold at heart." -- John Banville

item.title: Ted add a quote by Joe Orton
item.description: "With madness, as with vomit, it's the passerby who receives the inconvenience." -- Joe Orton

item.title: Ted add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "When my information changes, I alter my conclusions. What do you do, sir?" -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Ted add a quote by Ryszard Kapuściński
item.description: "If the crowd disperses, goes home, does not reassemble, we say the revolution is over." -- Ryszard Kapuściński

item.title: Ted add a quote by Peter Viereck
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you don't believe in it, doesn't go away." -- Peter Viereck

item.title: Ted add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "Out of Dostoevsky: Kafka. Out of Tolstoy: Margaret Mitchell. (in conversation, explaining his dislike for Tolstoy)" -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Ted add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to." -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Ted add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Pacifism is a tenable position, provided that you are prepared to live with the consequences." -- George Orwell

item.title: Ted add a quote by George Washington Plunkett on Tammany Hall (distinguishing between honest graft and dishonest graft)
item.description: "I might sum up the whole thing by sayin': I seen my opportunities and I took 'em." -- George Washington Plunkett on Tammany Hall (distinguishing between honest graft and dishonest graft)

item.title: Ted add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Fame is a form, perhaps the worst form, of incomprehension." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Ted add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Ted add a quote by Harold Pinter
item.description: "When you lead a life of scholarship you can't be bothered with the humorous realities, you know, tits, that kind of thing." -- Harold Pinter

item.title: Ted add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead on Hollywood
item.description: "Who do I have to fuck to get out of this business?" -- Tallulah Bankhead on Hollywood

item.title: Ted add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "There's a secret sickness called Lisa. Like all sicknesses, it's miserable and it comes on at night." -- Roberto Bolaño

item.title: Ted add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "I steal into their dreams," he said. "I steal into their most shameful thoughts, I'm in every shiver, every spasm of their souls, I steal into their hearts, I scrutinize their most fundamental beliefs, I scan their irrational impulses, their unspeakable emotions, I sleep in their lungs during the summer and their muscles during the winter, and all of this I do without the least effort, without intending to, without asking or seeking it out, without constraints, driven only by love and devotion." -- Roberto Bolaño
